newsitem.title: CANADA: CTV awarded two specialty channels - source.
newsitem.headline: CTV awarded two specialty channels - source.

text.p: The CTV television network was awarded on Wednesday a federal license to operate a new headline news channel on the cable television system as well as a regional sports network on future digital services in Canada, a senior company source said.
Both channels could begin operating by September of 1997, the source told Reuters.
The Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission will announce today a raft of new specialty channels for existing cable systems and new digital networks.

CTV is a widely held network whose ownership includes Baton Broadcasting Inc and Electrohome Ltd. Currently, the state-owned Canadian Broadcasting Corp operates an all-news channel and the Canadian Press news agency operates a cable headline service.
